responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Update center JSON generation omits the fractional part of plugin popularity scores
    analysis: |
      The `Popularities.getInstance().getPopularity` method is used to obtain a numerical
      score for plugin popularity. That score is parsed as a decimal number from JSON
      obtained via HTTP, but then cast to an integer before being included in update center
      metadata. This causes Jenkins to reject signatures because the SHA-512 checksums
      don't match the signed content.
    cwe: CWE-681
    function_names:
      - getPopularity
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/io/jenkins/update_center/Popularities.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Update center JSON generation omits the fractional part of plugin popularity scores
leads.analysis:
The Popularities.getInstance().getPopularity method is used to obtain a numerical
score for plugin popularity. That score is parsed as a decimal number from JSON
obtained via HTTP, but then cast to an integer before being included in update center
metadata. This causes Jenkins to reject signatures because the SHA-512 checksums
don't match the signed content.
